channel.title: Wii u, new nintendo console
channel.description:
[url]https://e3.nintendo.com/hw/#/video/HW_demo[/url] The console has been announced. The new remote is a 6.1 inch touchscreen with the normal buttons along the sides, plus all 4 shoulder buttons, a gyroscope and an accelerometer, camera, mic, and stereo speakers and stylus. Plus the TV. It has a ton of other features, including access to surfing the internet, a Nintendo store that appears to work like Steam, and is backwards compatible with all Wii accessories. Graphics are finally HD, but still not up to par with Xbox 360 and PS3. Upcoming confirmed titles:
A zelda game, A super smash brothers game that also plays on and syncs with the 3DS a new super mario brothers game Tom Clancy Ghost Recon Assassins Creed Dirt Aliens Metro Last Night Tekken Darksiders II (!) Ninja Gaiden 3 (!!) Battlefield 3 (!!!) and more that I can't remember right now.
EAs CEO came onstage and endorsed it, the first time they have for a Nintendo console.
There's more, add your info and I'll update this as I remember/see more.
EDIT: more info in no particular order
Remote: Used in whatever fashon game designers want it to be. Besides the obvious uses, such as an inventory screen for the new zelda game, it can be used for other innovative things, such as the ability to expand the game world all around you. So the TV screen is the main view, but then you can aim the handheld screen to your left and see what is to your left. Or, in Wii golf, it is used as the tee, so you set it on the ground and the ball appears on it and you swing over it. It also provides the possibility for asymetrical gameplay, such as in chase Mii, where one player runs on the handheld, and the other players thry to catch him on the big screen. Just imagine what they could do with a new Mario party. It has an IR sensor, but Nintendo officials said that might not make it to the final release. Video is streamed wirelessly to the controller, so as Orpheon said below this might keep price down since the controller requires less tech. Its also interesting because that means the console is rendering 2 different screens at once, meaning there might be more graphics power in it than we think. Also, note that they had 5 people playing in Chase Mii, which is interesting.
Console: The console is not finished. Nintendo was probably running their tech demos on reference hardware at E3. A mouse was seen on the screen of the Japanese Garden demo, and the games lineup movie are the 360 and PS3 versions of the games, which I am surprised Nintendo would admit so openly. But the console is still a year away, so this can be forgiven I think.
Japanese Garden tech demo: A prescripted scene rendered realtime on the TV with a camera controlled view rendered on the controller. Shows the power of the console. The shader effects are good, but the console doesn't handle a lot of geometry well at this point, aka there are a lot of jaggies.
The name Wii U is refering the the fact that it is still a console for everyone (Wii) but it also can be relevent to every individual (You).
Discuss

item.title: Wii u, new nintendo console
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
ac3d:

:meh: It’s already pretty damn affordable.

Why can’t Super Mario 3D Land come out on Wii? Instead it’s wasted on that pissy handheld with two screens.

I also want Mario Kart 7 for Wii, now, NOW!

Well, the 3DS needs those titles to be able to sell units. At this point, the Wii has received its fair share of Mario titles.

I’d say three core titles, an RPG, a Racer, and more than a few party games certainly justify the release of at least a couple new Mario games on the fledgling handheld.

For the record, the 3DS is better off without the 3D features, but it certainly adds a nice touch to some games. In fact Super Mario 3D Land is unplayable without it, and is integral to the experience.

Read full topic

item.title: Wii u, new nintendo console
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
I couldn’t justify myself getting a Wii for the Zelda games, and I can’t justify getting a Wii U for the Zelda games either. Plus, if you think the 360 or PS3 controllers are expensive, this one will be at least $20 more. Way too much. I, personally, wouldn’t like/use the controller screen, I already know this because I don’t much like having two screens on the DS/3DS.

Read full topic

item.title: Wii u, new nintendo console
item.dc:creator: Eddieb
item.description:
Shinobi:

“People had expected to see something more at a big event like… E3, but there wasn’t really anything more than what’s already reported.”

What?? Pretty much everything in the original post was new I think. Certainly the games list which I think is pretty solid for being a year out on production.

EDIT:
https://ps3.ign.com/articles/117/1173628p1.html
PSP 2 might work in tandem with the PS3, doing pretty much the same thing as the Wii U, and a year before.

If Nintendo release a new high power console six years after the Wii that can genuinely rival the PS3 and 360 on power- the rumour says it can beat them, but we’ll see- and at a reasonable price, I do think it makes the ten year plans of those consoles look silly. The Wii already made more than both of them probably ever will; if Nintendo can steal a march on them twice it is just nuts.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
Shinobi:

Also, where did they say it is more powerful than the PS3?

I believe the specs that are around state that its more powerful than the PS3. Its at least on par, which is the important thing; cross-platform games now will no longer skip the Wii. Shame about the lack of upscaling though; re-releases ahoy!

Also, this sums up my feelings on the matter perfectly.

item.title: Wii u, new nintendo console
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
DrasarSalman:

^Agree.

The wii u should be just a new controller to the wii. I mean it is just like a wii just… “wiiier” and with old school Nintendo technology with some aspects seen in the DS.

It is basically a DS and a wii remote stuffed in a PSP at the size of an iPad.

Well I mean supposedly the console is more powerful than the PS3 which I think is worth a new console. Plus they’re going to have better third party support. I just think it’s a terrible time to come out with a new console.

Read full topic

item.title: Wii u, new nintendo console
item.dc:creator: DrasarSalman
item.description:
mental2k:

I’m yet to be convinced, yeah the graphics are definitely better, but at the end of the day is it really bringing anything new? It wouldn’t appeal to me more as a hardcore gamer, that new pad is every bit as bad looking as the original wii pad for decent gaming, if not worse. But I’m probably just an old fart.

Kairouseki:

You buy the console which comes with one controller and that’s the only controller you can have. There will not be controllers for sale separately.

^Agree.

The wii u should be just a new controller to the wii. I mean it is just like a wii just… “wiiier” and with old school Nintendo technology with some aspects seen in the DS.

It is basically a DS and a wii remote stuffed in a PSP at the size of an iPad.

Read full topic
